How do you disengage from a champ with a MS steroid and a small dash every 2 seconds? 
Her entire kit is point and click. 
She has no counterplay as does many adcs. 
A lot of adcs can be dodged, jhin, varus for example. 
But everything on vayne is point and click. 
Her only counterplay is burst her or CC her which isn't sufficient tbh since that never counted for statstick bruisers who got nerfed into oblivion.

> How do you disengage from a champ with a MS steroid and a small dash every 2 seconds?

You conveniently forgot to mention how her dash is only 2 seconds at maximum rank. And that it doesn't go on cooldown unless she auto attacks. So if she doesn't auto attack someone/or can auto attack someone then her Q will be on a 13/12/11/10/9 second cooldown. 

But lets list off the ways you can disengage from Vayne.

- Any form of crowd control or displacement which the game has been heavily saturated with.
- A heavy hitting spell like Brand W or Karma Q can easily get her to back off.
- Just burst the squishy ADC with 550 range who is running directly at you. 
- Use your own mobility (Gosh its easy to forget that you have _your own kit_ with its _own strengths_ just like Vayne.) Anyways this could be a movement speed steroid, a dash, a blink, or some oddball like Bard portal and Kayn E. 
- Zone her off with something like an Anivia wall or Zyra plant. 

> She has no counterplay as does many adcs.

This isn't true because you can dodge her E from pinning you into a wall. Thats one way to counter her via playing the game, which makes your statement false. 

Now the statement that would be more accurate and I could agree with would be, "She doesn't have enough counterplay." Which is fair and can be backed up.

> Her only counterplay is burst her or CC her which isn't sufficient tbh since that never counted for statstick bruisers who got nerfed into oblivion.

Because statstick bruisers usually were not burstable/unharmed by crowd control. Yeah that Vel'Koz rotation is going to hurt like hell to the Vayne, but the Volibear might not care as much. 

And Vayne is supposed to be a hyper carry. Maybe her early game isn't weak enough, but she is supposed to be a hyper carry. Just like Fiora and Master Yi, Vayne is a super squishy duelist who's supposed to be weak to a team's focus/CC but will deal tremendous damage late game and when unchecked.

After supporting a few Vaynes and getting wins because of that when games shouldn't have won, can confirm.

Well you see Vayne is one of those champions who are difficult to balance, like Ezreal for instance. They are either bad or good, rarely inbetween. She was designed in a meta where tanks/bruisers were the main problem so they made her to combat that. Now since that tank/bruiser meta was toned down, vayne began to fall off because of her inability to dish out any damage due to the "range" meta we see nowadays due to her small aa range. 
If Vayne is able to get to your squishies (mainly your adc/support) then it's really your team's fault for letting her get close. You should be peeling your adc and keeping your support safe while they deal damage from the backline.
